Raphael Bottura Corbi

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/0306001183992855
  • Última atualização do currículo em 01/04/2019

Professor Associado Livre-Docente no departamento de Economia da USP. PhD em Economia pela London Business School (2014), mestrado em Economia pela FEA-USP (2007) e graduação em Economia pela FEA-USP (2004). Desenvolve sua atividade de pesquisa nas áreas de Economia/Econometria Aplicada, com ênfase em tópicos de Economia Política, Macroeconomia Aplicada, Finanças Publicas e Micro-desenvolvimento. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2017 - Atual
Emotional Voters
Descrição: This paper analyzes the impact of emotional shocks induced by soccer game results on incumbent's vote share in Brazilian elections. Conditioning on the pregame betting markets implied probabilities of each match outcome, I am able to interpret the estimate of actual soccer results as a causal effect on voting behavior. The main findings indicate that a 10 p.p. increase in the share of people in a municipality experiencing negative emotional shocks in the days preceding an election decreases voting for the incumbent mayor by 1.1 p.p. In contrast, positive emotional shocks do not influence voting in most cases. This asymmetric effect is stronger for games with higher stadium attendance, for local teams and for more intense emotional shocks. Similar findings arise when I focus on gubernatorial and presidential elections. These patterns cannot be explained by turnout and disappear when I focus on close electoral races. Furthermore, I show that a similar close election pattern is also found in a different setting using Spanish data from Bagues and Esteve-Volart (2016) and provide extra evidence from Google searches that individuals actively seek more information about candidates in close elections. Overall these results are consistent with a behavioral political economy model with emotional voters whose behavior deviate from the forecasts of rational theory. Such deviation decreases with how close elections are as these tend to make information about candidates more salient in the media thus lowering the attention cost to picking the best candidate..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador.
2016 - 2018
Regional Transfers
Descrição: We exploit a series of discontinuities, at several population thresholds, in the allocation mechanism of federal transfers to municipal governments in Brazil to identify the causal effect of municipal spending on local labor markets, using a ?fuzzy? regression discontinuity design. Our estimates imply a cost per job of about 8,000 US dollars per year, mostly driven by employment in services, and a local income multiplier of around two. A currency union model with nominal rigidities and liquidity constraints implies that the stimulative effects would have been substantially smaller if local government spending was financed by local tax revenues rather than regional transfers. (previously circulated as Federal Transfers Multiplier).
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador / Elias Papaioannou - Integrante / Paolo Surico - Integrante.
2016 - Atual
The Gospel according to Radio: Religious Media and Rise of Pentecostalism in Brazil
Descrição: A América Latina e, em particular, o Brasil, tem apresentado uma relevante transformação no panorama das religiões nas últimas décadas. Entre 2000 e 2010 se verifica uma forte redução da grande maioria católica, simultânea à expansão da população de evangélicos. Transformações como essas podem se relacionar com mudanças em outras dimensões do comportamento individual, como a educação dos filhos e preferências político-eleitorais. O objetivo desse trabalho é de examinar quantitativamente o crescimento da participação dos evangélicos na população brasileira, especificamente por meio da expansão da oferta de serviços religiosos através dos canais de comunicação ligados aos grupos evangélicos. Utilizaremos dados de estações transmissoras de sinal de radiodifusão e um mo- delo técnico que leva em conta variações de relevo para prever variações de qualidade de recepção do sinal de transmissoras ligadas a grupos religiosos evangélicos entre regiões. Exploraremos a variação da qualidade da recepção do sinal devida ao relevo, condicional à distância à estação transmissora, para identificar o efeito das estações ligadas aos grupos religiosos.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador / Bruno Kawaoka Komatsu - Integrante.
2016 - Atual
Diamonds Are Forever: Long-Run Effects of Colonial Mining Institutions in Brazil
Descrição: This paper uses a spatial first-difference approach to investigate the long-term impact of the Distrito Diamantino, a set of colonial policies adopted in colonial Brazil during the 1734-1832 period to control the mining of diamonds. Our results show that current household income and adult literacy are higher within the District. Using contemporary census data, we find that current settlements that belong to the corresponding area of the District also have higher urbanization rates. We also present historical evidence from 1872 and 1890 census data that areas inside the District have persistently higher human capital levels. Using a geospatial road location database and vector data constructed from historical maps, we find that observations inside the District?s historical boundaries have denser road networks today, but this was not true a century ago. Additionally we use data from the 1830s and from the 1872 census to show that the presence of slaves was more intense inside the District but such difference vanishes after the decline of diamond extraction.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador / Marcelo Sacchi de Carvalho - Integrante.
2015 - 2018
Unintended Consequences of Unemployment Insurance: Evidence from Stricter Eligibility Criteria in Brazil
Descrição: This paper investigates the impact of changes in the eligibility criteria of unemployment benefits (UI) on layoffs in Brazil. We exploit exogenous variation introduced by a reform in the UI system in 2015. Our difference-in-differences estimates show that UI accounts for 11−13% of the average dismissal rates of eligible workers. Our results are consistent with workers having the incentive to strategically induce their dismissals in order to collect UI benefits..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador / Renata del Tedesco Narita - Integrante / Cristiano Costa Carvalho - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
Size of Legislature, Public Spending and Political Budget Cycle
Descrição: This paper exploits a constitutional rule in Brazil that has been enforced in the municipal elections in 2004 which sets limits to the number of municipal councillors according to local population. By exploring this exogenous change, I am able to identify that a decrease in the size of municipal legislature increases total spending over the subsequent mandate.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Raphael Bottura Corbi - Coordenador.
